body.p: The bundle contains two works attributed to Auvaiyār: the Ātticūṭi (complete) and the Koṉṟaivēntāṉ (complete). Both are named Nīticcol ("moral maxims") in the manuscript.These works are often used for learning the Tamil alphabet as the aphorisms are ordered alphabetically and represent all the letters of the Tamil alphabet. The bundle is possibly a school exercise. The lay-out of the page is in columns for the mūlam.
The bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains between the two woodcovers:
U1a: 1 folio, unfoliated = Ātticūṭi, invocation, by hand n° 1. With shelfmark in ink: N° 19.
U1b: 5 folios, Tamil foliation 1–5 = Ātticūṭi, mūlam, by hand n° 1. f1-f3 only are sufficiently blackened with soot.
U2a: 1 folio, unfoliated = Koṉṟaivēntāṉ, invocation, by hand n° 2.
U2b: 4 folios, unfoliated, unblackened with soot = Koṉṟaivēntāṉ, mūlam, by hand n° 2.
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions; invocations; completion statement; authorship and title; colophon; owner's mention; owners'marks.

U1a, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = Ātticūṭi, invocation: marginal benedictions; stanza.
(f[1]r, lm1) hari Om
NB: the word hari is written inside the wordOm.
(f[1]r, lm2) naṉṟāka
(f[1]r1) Ātticūṭi-y amainta-t tēvarai-y ētti-y ētti toḻuvōm ṉāmē {pcs} vāṇinamastu {pcs}

U1b, folio 1, recto = Ātticūṭi,incipit, mūlam: marginal benediction; first 2 aphorisms.
(f1r, lm) {pcs} naṉṟāka
(f1r, c1, 1) Aṟañ cey
(f1r, c1, 2) virumpu
(f1r, c1, 3) Āṟuvatu
(f1r, c1, 3) ciṉam
(...)

U1b, folio 5, recto, = Ātticūṭi,excipit, mūlam: last aphorism; author, title and completion statement; owner's mention.
(f5r, c1, 1) vañcakam
(f5r, c1, 2) pēcēṉ
(f5r, c2, 1) vovaiyār [i.e. AUvaiyār]
(f5r, c2, 2) Aruḷi ceyta
(f5r, c2, 3) nīti-c-col
(f5r, c3, 1) muṟṟum {pcl}
(f5r, c3, 2) Aṅkappaṉ cevaṭi [i.e. cuvaṭi?]
(f5r, c3, 3) muṟṟum {pcl}

U2a, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = Koṉṟaivēntāṉ, invocation: stanza.
(f[1]r, lm1) hari Om
(f[1]r, lm2) naṉṟāka
(f[1]r, lm2) kuru vāḻka
(f[1]r1) koṉṟai vēntaṉ celvaṉ aṭiyiṇai-y eṉṟum ētti toḻuvōm yāmē {pcs} vāṇinamastttu {pcs}

U2b, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = Koṉṟaivēntāṉ, mūlam, incipit : marginal benediction; first aphorism.
(f[1]r, lm) naṉṟāka
(f[1]r, c1, 1) aṉṉaiyum pitāvum
(f[1]r, c1, 2) muṉṉaṟi teyvam
(...)

U2b, folio 4, verso, unfoliated = Koṉṟaivēntāṉ, mūlam, excipit : last aphorism; author, title and completion statement; benediction.
(...)

(f4v, c5, 2) v uṇarpaṭa-v oḻukkam
(f4v, c5, 3) vauyār = [i.e. AUvaiyār]
(f4v, c5, 4) y-aruḷi-c- ceyta
(f4v, c6, 1) nīti-c-col

U3, folio 1, recto and verso, unfoliated = owners' marks: 2 personal names.
(f[1]r1, right-aligned) ṟāmacāmi
(f[1]r2, right-aligned) rāmacami
(f[1]v1, centred) ṟāmacāmi-p
(f[1]v2, centred) puḷḷai
(f[1]v3, centred) Aṅkappaṉ
(f[1]v4, centred) puḷḷai
Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin,U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, andē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is notclearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kālor length of o and e)readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated byslash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X".Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets.Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...).Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha lettersin bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towardsright; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number betweensquare brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121"not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphensystematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word orwithin a cīr. Sandhi splitto the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as anapostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible.aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
